description:
jkearney@ubuntu:~/openstack/python-cloudservers$ cloudservers diagnostics 5
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/cloudservers", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('python-cloudservers==1.2', 'console_scripts', 'cloudservers')()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/shell.py", line 502, in main
    CloudserversShell().main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/shell.py", line 137, in main
    args.func(args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/shell.py", line 390, in do_diagnostics
    print_dict(self.cs.servers.diagnostics(args.server)[1])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/servers.py", line 295, in diagnostics
    return self.api.client.get("/servers/%s/diagnostics" % base.getid(server))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/client.py", line 80, in get
    return self._cs_request(url, 'GET', **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/client.py", line 68, in _cs_request
    resp, body = self.request(self.management_url + url, method, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/client.py", line 55, in request
    raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body)
cloudservers.exceptions.CloudServersException: Error Instance not present instance-00000005
['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "\\/home\\/jkearney\\/openstack\\/lp697841\\/nova\\/rpc.py", line 192, in receive\n    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n', '  File "\\/home\\/jkearney\\/openstack\\/lp697841\\/nova\\/exception.py", line 89, in _wrap\n    raise Error(str(e))\n', 'Error: Instance not present instance-00000005\n'] (HTTP 500)
title: Trunk breaks diagnostics API query

comments.content:
jkearney@ubuntu:~/openstack/python-cloudservers$ cloudservers diagnostics 5
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/cloudservers", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('python-cloudservers==1.2', 'console_scripts', 'cloudservers')()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/shell.py", line 502, in main
    CloudserversShell().main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/shell.py", line 137, in main
    args.func(args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/shell.py", line 390, in do_diagnostics
    print_dict(self.cs.servers.diagnostics(args.server)[1])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/servers.py", line 295, in diagnostics
    return self.api.client.get("/servers/%s/diagnostics" % base.getid(server))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/client.py", line 80, in get
    return self._cs_request(url, 'GET', **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/client.py", line 68, in _cs_request
    resp, body = self.request(self.management_url + url, method, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/python_cloudservers-1.2-py2.6.egg/cloudservers/client.py", line 55, in request
    raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body)
cloudservers.exceptions.CloudServersException: Error Instance not present instance-00000005
['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "\\/home\\/jkearney\\/openstack\\/lp697841\\/nova\\/rpc.py", line 192, in receive\n    rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)\n', '  File "\\/home\\/jkearney\\/openstack\\/lp697841\\/nova\\/exception.py", line 89, in _wrap\n    raise Error(str(e))\n', 'Error: Instance not present instance-00000005\n'] (HTTP 500)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jk0

comments.content: Turns out this is only an issue with instances that existed before the trunk merge. I fired up a new instance on the latest trunk and the names/IDs match up and worked as expected. Marking bug as Invalid.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jk0
